JavaLog
Class Brain

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--JavaLog.PlEngine
        |
        +--JavaLog.Brain
Direct Known Subclasses:
BrainLet, MobileBrainEngine
public class Brain
extends PlEngine

This class makes PlEngine user friendly adding some facilities to the interpreter.

A Brain object stores a set of LogicKnowledge objects, each of them has an id, which can be used to activate the knowledge (clauses and queries) stored into the LogicKnowledge objects. You can think that each LogicKnowledge object stored into a Brain is like a traditional procedure (a capability in JavaLog jargon). Then you can invoke that procedure (capability) by means of activeCapability method, enabling the clauses and executing the queries which it contain.

Creation of capabilities is done by means of addCapability method. This operation adds a capability to the set of stored capabilities. Knowledge contained into capabilities is not available to normal user's queries until activeCapability is invoked. Knowledge activated in this way is available until activation of a capability with queries is performed. When this happens, the knowledge previously activated is deactivated.

Version:
$Revision: 1.1 $ $ProjectDate: Thu, 10 Jun 1999 17:11:12 -0300 $
See Also:
LogicKnowledge, Preprocessor

                          LogicKnowledge lk)

addCapability

public void addCapability(java.lang.Object id,
                          java.lang.String knowledge)
Adds to this brain a capability knowledge named id. A capability is like a procedure composed by clauses and queries which can be called by means of the activeCapability method. This method receives a string whith capability contents. That string is used to create a LogicKnowledge object (i.e. the string must be a legal Prolog program).
Parameters:
id - the identifier of this capability.
knowledge - an instance of LogicKnowledge.
See Also:
activeCapability

addCapability

public void addCapability(java.lang.Object id,
                          java.lang.String knowledge,
                          int v)
Adds to this brain a capability knowledge named id. A capability is like a procedure composed by clauses and queries which can be called by means of the activeCapability method. This method receives a string whith capability contents. That string is used to create a LogicKnowledge object (i.e. the string must be a legal Prolog program). A capability can contain a number of Java objects (i.e. the capability is a Prolog program using some Java objects). The parameter v is the number of Java objects which knowledge stores.
Parameters:
id - the identifier of this capability.
knowledge - an instance of LogicKnowledge.
v - this parameter tells to this brain how many Java objects contain the new capability.
See Also:
activeCapability

Parameters:
query - valid Prolog term.
Returns:
true if query is solvable.

answerQuery

public boolean answerQuery(java.lang.String query,
                           java.lang.Object[] args)
This method tries to solve a single Prolog query containing Java objects. It stores the results (if evaluation suceeds) for later access.
Parameters:
query - valid Prolog term.
args - an array of Java objects referenced in query by positional parameters $0, $1, ...
Returns:
true if query is solvable.
See Also:
